page.title: 15VILLAGE CONCERNS
page.content:
The villagers at first found the JET project alarming: the size of the building appeared a blot on the land- scape and the blue colour did not blend into the countryside. Since then however, the villagers have seen that there are some advantages such as raising the value of property and lowering rates.
Concern about traffic problems has, nevertheless, remained. When JET was first established there were tailbacks to the village until sliproads were built. As it lies on the direct route from Didcot to Cowley, traffic continues to be far too heavy for a B road. Rumours that Didcot industry is to expand make the inhabitants fear that the problem will become even worse.
